intro: Pseuderanthemum repandum subsp. repandum, commonly known as the spreading pseuderanthemum, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in tropical and subtropical climates.
